short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Best highlighting tool for Website and PDF. FREE and easy to use.
short.es,es_419: Resalta, anota y marca tu línea de investigación con varios colores. Organízalos en colecciones.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_U:
Highlight & organize your research with Weava online Web & PDF highlighter.

Simplify your research process. Focus on Productivity. Don't waste time on keeping track of sources, copying & pasting, or making citations. On average, our users report that the Chrome extension helps them save 3.8+ hours each week. That's a lot of hours that you instead can spend on the things that really matters to you.

WITH WEAVA YOU CAN:
  ➤ Highlight websites and PDFs with multiple colors, and make annotations. Revisit them with a single click.
  ➤ Organise your highlights into folders and sub-folders.
  ➤ Create citations automatically for your highlights.
  ➤ Access your highlights anywhere. Your highlights and notes are saved in the cloud.

★ TRUSTED BY 2,000,000+ USERS:
Weava is trusted by students, researchers, business professionals, and people who simply just want to do better and more efficient work. The tool adapts to your needs and research style, giving you the flexibility to review your articles & sources every time you research online.

★ WEAVA PREMIUM:
If you want to supercharge your research and maximize efficiency, Weava Premium is your answer. Here are some of the things that you can do with Premium:
  ➤ Customize any color you want
  ➤ Create unlimited sub-folders to organize highlights
  ➤ Unlimited storage in the cloud to store your files
  ➤ Clip images and save them in the workspace
  ➤ Collaborate with your friends or team in real-time

★ FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS & CUSTOMER SUPPORT:
For frequently asked questions (FAQs) and customer support, please see: https://weavatools.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals

★ IMPORTANT THINGS TO NOTE:
➤ Please note that Weava only visually renders the highlights from your current active folder. 
➤ You can enable/disable the highlighter pop-up with the keyboard shortcut Alt+S (Option+S on Mac). And you can customize your keyboard shortcuts in your Google Chrome settings (chrome://extensions/shortcuts)
➤ While the tool works on most websites, please note that some websites have conflicting code that results in the Weava highlighter not functioning properly. 
➤ Weava fetches and visually renders your color highlights based on the respective URL you first made the highlight on (for websites and online PDFs). Please note that, while your highlights and annotations are always saved in the sidebar and dashboard, if the website URL for some reason changes, then the visual rendering of your highlights are not visible unless you update the URL in the "Edit Source" functionality on the dashboard. 
➤ You can 1) highlight local PDFs directly from your computer. 2) Online PDFs, and 3) upload PDFs directly to Weava. Uploading PDFs will ensure you the smoothest experience.
➤ You are currently unable to directly highlight on PDFs inside certain 3rd party software, such as in Google Classroom, Blackboard and Canvas. Instead you would need to first download the PDF and then use it with Weava. We hope to have better solutions towards this in the future.

★ CHROME EXTENSION PERMISSIONS EXPLAINED:
Weava's requested permissions are needed for the tool to function properly. However, the exact phrases provided by Chrome for these permissions are misleading and make them sound more invasive than they actually are — and you will generally see the same exact warnings on practically all Chrome extensions. Here's a further breakdown of the required permissions to run Weava:
① "Read and change all your data on the website you visit"
➤ "Read": The Weava Chrome extension has passed all of Google’s automated and manual security checks and is safe to use. The extension reads the current URL of the page you make highlights on - and is also checking if you have existing highlights on this URL so that it can visually show these to you. That's it.
➤"Change": Weava needs to modify the website you are visiting in order to show you the Chrome extension highlighter pop-up on top of it. Weava also needs this permission to be able to change the text background color accordingly whenever you make a highlight.
② "Modify data you copy and paste."
➤ Weava needs this permission simply to create and save the highlights you are making. Without it we would just be a nice color tool but without the capabilities to save the exact content you highlighted and show this to you in the sidebar and dashboard.
③ Separately, in the Weava Chrome extension settings, you can enable "Allow access to file URLs" which gives Weava permission to read PDF local file paths so that you can highlight PDFs directly from local files on your computer. Similarly to highlights on websites, it ONLY reads the file path of the file you are highlighting on and it is only doing this in order to be able to save the highlight and to fetch and visually render these highlights on subsequent visits.

By installing the extension, you agree to Weava's Terms and and Privacy Policy (https://weavatools.com/terms-and-privacy).

Simplify your research process. Focus on Productivity. Don't waste time on keeping track of sources, copying & pasting, or making citations.   ➤ Highlight websites and PDFs with multiple colours, and make annotations. Revisit them with a single click.

Weava is trusted by students, researchers, business professionals, and people who simply just want to do better and more efficient work. Weava adapts to your needs and research style, giving you the flexibility to review your articles & sources every time you research online.

★ WEAVA PREMIUM:
If you want to supercharge your research and maximise efficiency, Weava Premium is your answer. Here are some of the things that you can do with Premium:
  ➤ Customise any colour you want 
  ➤ Create unlimited sub-folders to organise highlights
  ➤ Unlimited storage in the cloud to store your files
  ➤ Clip images and save them in the Weava workspace
  ➤ Collaborate with your friends or team in real-time

★ FEATURE REQUESTS:
We're building Weava for you, so please submit and vote on feature requests that you'd like to see us prioritise here: https://weava.upvoty.com/

★ FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS & CUSTOMER SUPPORT:
For frequently asked questions (FAQs) and customer support, please see: https://weavatools.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals

Please note that, while your highlights and annotations are always saved in the Weava sidebar and dashboard, if the website URL for some reason changes, then the visual rendering of your highlights are not visible unless you update the URL in the "Edit Source" functionality on the Weava dashboard.

➤ You are currently unable to directly highlight on PDFs inside certain 3rd party software, such as in Google Classroom, Blackboard and Canvas. Instead you would need to first download the PDF and then use it with Weava. We hope to have better solutions towards this in the future.

★ WEAVA CHROME EXTENSION PERMISSIONS EXPLAINED:

However, the exact phrases provided by Chrome for these permissions are misleading and make them sound more invasive than they actually are — and you will generally see the same exact warnings on practically all Chrome extensions. ① "Read and change all your data on the website you visit"
➤ "Read": The Weava Chrome extension has passed all of Google’s automated and manual security checks and is safe to use. The extension reads the current URL of the page you make highlights on - and is also checking if you have existing highlights on this URL so that it can visually show these to you. That's it.
➤"Change": Weava needs to modify the website you are visiting in order to show you the Chrome extension highlighter pop-up on top of it. Weava also needs this permission to be able to change the text background colour accordingly whenever you make a highlight.

③ Separately, in the Weava Chrome extension settings, you can enable "Allow access to file URLs" which gives Weava permission to read PDF local file paths so that you can highlight PDFs directly from local files on your computer. Similarly to highlights on websites, it ONLY reads the file path of the file you are highlighting on and it is only doing this in order to be able to save the highlight and to fetch and visually render these highlights on subsequent visits.

By installing the extension, you agree to Weava's Terms and and Privacy Policy (https://weavatools.com/terms-and-privacy).
long.es:
Subraya y organiza tu investigación utilizando Weava online y el subrayador de Weava para PDF.

Simplifica tu proceso de investigación. Céntrate en la productividad. No pierdas el tiempo haciendo un seguimiento de las fuentes, copiando y pegando, o haciendo citaciones. En promedio, nuestros usuarios indican que Weava les ayuda a ahorrar más de 3,8 horas a la semana. Esas son horas que, en cambio, podrías dedicar a las cosas que realmente te importan.

CON WEAVA PUEDES:
  ➤ Subrayar las páginas web y los archivos de PDF con diversos colores, y también hacer anotaciones. Además de poder revisarlas con un solo clic.
  ➤ Organizar tus subrayados en carpetas y subcarpetas.
  ➤ Crear citaciones automáticas para tus subrayados. 
  ➤ Acceder a tus subrayados desde cualquier lugar. Tus subrayados y notas se guardarán en la nube.

★ CON LA CONFIANZA DE MÁS DE 600.000+ USUARIOS:
Estudiantes, investigadores, profesionales de negocios y personas que simplemente quieren hacer un trabajo mejor y más eficiente confían en Weava. Weava se adapta a tus necesidades y a tu estilo de investigación, proporcionando la flexibilidad de revisar tus artículos y fuentes cada vez que investigues en línea.

★ WEAVA PREMIUM:
Si deseas potenciar más allá tu investigación y maximizar tu eficiencia, Weava Premium es la respuesta. Estas son algunas de las cosas que puede hacer con Weava Premium:
  ➤ Personalizar cualquier color que quieras
  ➤ Crear subcarpetas ilimitadas para organizar los subrayados
  ➤ Acceder almacenamiento ilimitado en la nube para almacenar tys archivos
  ➤ Seleccionar imágenes y guardarlas en el espacio de trabajo de Weava
  ➤ Colaborar con tus amigos o equipo en tiempo real

★ SOLICITUD DE FUNCIONES:
Estamos creando Weava para tí, así que envíe y vote en las solicitudes de funciones que le gustaría que prioricemos: https://weava.upvoty.com/

★ PREGUNTAS FRECUENTES Y ASISTENCIA AL CLIENTE:
Para preguntas frecuentes (FAQ) y apoyo al cliente, consulte: https://weavatools.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals

★ COSAS IMPORTANTES A TENER EN CUENTA:
➤Ten en cuenta que Weava solo muestra visualmente los subrayados de la carpeta activa en cada momento. 
➤ Puedes habilitar / deshabilitar la ventana emergente del resaltador de Weava usando el atajo del teclado Alt+S (Option+S on Mac). También puedes personalizar tus accesos directos de Weava en la configuración de Google Chrome (chrome://extensions/shortcuts)
➤ Aunque Weava funciona en la mayoría de las páginas web, tenga en cuenta que algunas páginas web tienen códigos en conflicto, los cuales hacen que el resaltador Weava no funcione correctamente.
➤Weava extrae y visualmente realiza tus subrayados de color en función del URL respectivo donde hizo el primer resaltado (para páginas web y PDF en línea). Tenga en cuenta que, aunque tus subrayados y las anotaciones siempre se guarden en la barra lateral y el panel de Weava, en caso de que el URL de la página web cambie por alguna razón, tus subrayados no serán visibles a menos de que actualice la URL en la función "Editar fuente" en el tablero de Weava.
➤ Puedes 1) resaltar archivos PDF locales directamente desde tu ordenador. 2) PDFs en línea y 3) subir archivos de PDF directamente a Weava. Subir los archivos de PDF le garantizará una experiencia más fluida.
➤ Actualmente, no se puede subrayar documentos PDF directamente dentro de ciertos software de terceros partidos, como Google Classroom, Blackboard y Canvas. En su lugar, debe descargar el PDF y luego usarlo con Weava. Esperamos tener mejores soluciones para esto en el futuro.

★ EXPLICACIÓN DE LOS PERMISOS DE EXTENSIÓN DE WEAVA CHROME:
Los permisos solicitados por Weava son necesarios para que Weava funcione correctamente. Sin embargo, las frases proporcionadas por Chrome para estos permisos son engañosas y hacen que suenen más invasivas de lo que realmente son, y por lo general, verá las mismas advertencias en prácticamente todas las extensiones de Chrome. Aquí hay un desglose adicional de los permisos necesarios para ejecutar Weava:
① "Leer y modificar todos tuss datos en la página web que visite""
➤ "Leer": la extensión de Weava para Chrome ha pasado todos los controles de seguridad manuales y automáticos de Google y su uso es seguro. La extensión lee el URL actual de la página en la que subrayas, y también verifica si ya tienes algunos subrayados en este URL para que pueda mostrártelos visualmente. Eso es todo.
➤"Modificar": Weava necesita modificar la página web que está navegando para mostrarle el subrayador emergente de la extensión de Chrome en la parte superior. Weava también necesita este permiso para poder cambiar el color de fondo del texto acorde siempre que subrayes algo.
②"Modificar la información que copia y pega"
➤ Weava simplemente necesita este permiso para crear y guardar los subrayados que estás realizando. Sin él, seríamos una buena herramienta de color, pero sin las capacidades para guardar el contenido exacto que resaltó y mostrárselo en la barra lateral y el tablero de Weava.
③ Por separado, en la configuración de la extensión de Weava Chrome, puedes habilitar "Permitir el acceso a los URL de los archivos". Esto permite a Weava que lea las rutas de los archivos de PDF locales para que pueda resaltar los PDF directamente desde el ordenador. Parecido a los subrayados en las páginas web, Weava SÓLO lee la ruta del archivo que está subrayando y sólo lo hace para poder guardar el elemento subrayado y recuperar y representar visualmente estos subrayados en visitas posteriores.

Al instalar la extensión, acepta los Términos y la Política de privacidad de Weava (https://weavatools.com/terms-and-privacy).
